intro: Thunia × gatton, commonly known as the hybrid thunia, is a rare and ornamental plant resulting from the cross between Thunia flaccida and Thunia grandiflora. It is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often with a distinctive violet or purple hue at the base. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy, adding visual interest throughout the growing season. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, Thunia × gatton is often cultivated in specialized botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of rare plant species.
